result.execSummary:
All charges against Peter B Hamilton in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter B Hamilton is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter B Hamilton

records.addlTxt: Defendant Peter B Hamilton in court, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss case. Court grants dismissal.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Status continued.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases continued for possible global resolution. Status set.
Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton. Defendant heard on bond Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Anthony Vandervelden sworn and testifies. Exhibit #1 Report offered and received. Court takes judicial notice of 22CF19. Court heard on bond. Court finds probable cause to bind over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond remains. Status and trial weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant needs to contact SPD for this new case. State requests $200 cash bond with a condition not to posses or consume any intoxicants. Defendant heard on bond. Court heard and orders $100 cash bond with the conditions not to possess or consume any intoxicants and not to have contact with victims in 22CF19. Prelim hearing set.
Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant shall have no contact with victims in 22CF19.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicants.
